history.content:
Dear Students,
Hope you all are hanging in there while midterm season is in full swing! You are almost half way through the semester!!

Enrollment Policy for Math 104, 110, 113, 128A, and 185

During "Phase 1" of registration, seats in Math 104, 110, 113, 128A and 185 will be reserved for students in the following 3 groups:

  • Declared Mathematics and Applied Math majors

  • Undeclared students in the College of Letters & Science

  • Incoming Math & Applied Math Fall 2018 transfer students

 

Students who are currently declared in another major but who plan to double-major with Math or Applied Math should plan to add their double-major within the next 4-5 weeks if they want Phase 1 priority for registering for Math 104, 110, 113, 128A or 185 in Fall 2018.   Instructions for declaring the major can be found here (and including booking an appointment with Math advisors Ana Renteria or Thomas Brown).

 

Graduate students, undergraduates from outside of Letters & Science, and declared Letters & Science students who aren't double or triple majoring with Mathematics or Applied Mathematics will need to add to the waiting list during Phase 1 or wait until Phase 2 to add these courses.  The department remains committed to doing our best to meet the demand for math courses from all majors.

Invitation to WICSE 40th Anniversary Celebration

Celebration of Women in Technology - UC Berkeley WICSE 40th Anniversary will be hosted by Women in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering on Saturday, March 17th, 2018 from 11am - 8pm.


Join us for a day packed full of reunions, enlightening talks, and networking opportunities!


We are proud to be including speakers throughout the day including Prof. Tsu-Jae King Liu. Prof. Liu was the Chair of the Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from July 2014-June 2016, and is the current Vice-Provost for Academic and Space Planning at University of California, Berkeley.


WICSE is also planning a day of activities including lightning talks on career paths and research by current graduate students and alumni, retrospectives on WICSE history, as well as panels and discussions on diversity within electrical engineering and computer science. We hope this event will foster mentorship and visibility for alumnae and current students. Register to attend today!


Register to attend today: WICSE 40th Anniversary Celebration

Spring Undergraduate Research Symposium Poster Session

Engineering Student Services is pleased to present the Spring Undergraduate Research Symposium Poster Session


Date: Monday, April 30th

Time: 12 to 2 pm

Location:  Hearst Memorial Mining Building Lobby  


Undergraduate students (ranging from freshmen to seniors) will be presenting their research on a wide range of projects across the College of Engineering.


How to Participate:

The poster session is open to all College of Engineering undergraduate students working Engineering Faculty!

Submit here. The deadline to submit Abstracts is April 15th

Shadow an Engineer

Curious what it's like to be an engineer in industry? Apply for Shadow an Engineer Program hosted by Society of Women Engineers! Through this program, you will have the opportunity to get real-life exposure at some of the most innovative companies in the area! This program will occur for 1 to 3 days over spring break and is an awesome chance to network with the company you might want to work for in the future. The application will close on Sunday, March 4th, 2018 at 4PM. Apply early! Check out the participating company descriptions and the Facebook event. All genders are encouraged to apply.

Women in Leadership Conference

Join the Berkeley Haas Women In Leadership group for their annual conference, March 17, 8:30 a.m. - 7:30 p.m. This year's theme is Evolve: Develop. Progress. Advance, and you'll spend the day immersed in conversation with over 300 emerging and current business leaders. Sounds great! How do I sign up? Get your tickets here!

AI Office Hours for Entrepreneurs by Pieter Abbeel, Rocky Duan, Peter Chen

Announcing AI Office Hours with Pieter Abbeel, Rocky Duan, Peter Chen, three of the world's leading AI experts in deep learning, reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning, and robotics.

This office hour is meant for start-ups (or start-ups/projects in the making) who want to discuss their AI strategy as well as concrete challenges when building AI systems.

Learn More & Sign Up Here: https://thehouse.build/office-hours/

National Engineers Week with BART

BART is celebrating National Engineers Week this week by profiling a different engineering discipline each day, and holding a Twitter Town Hall on Friday, Feb. 23, from noon – 1 pm.

Students can read the stories on the BART website and formulate questions to ask our engineers in real-time during the Town Hall on Friday.  So far we have published a story on Systems Engineering and one on Mechanical/Electrical Engineering. We will cover Structural Engineering on Wednesday and Civil Engineering on Thursday.


Below are the links to the relevant information. Students can follow along with the Town Hall on Friday by sending their questions to @SFBART on Twitter.

https://www.bart.gov/news/articles/2018/news20180216

https://www.bart.gov/news/articles/2018/news20180216-0


BART has many engineering jobs to fill (along with internships) and will have more in the future as we rebuild our system. We want students to be aware of all the interesting challenges that come with working for BART, in hopes they may one day consider us on their career paths.

2nd Annual First-Generation Student Career Conference

Friday, March 2- 1:30-6:30pm

Career Center, Blue and Gold Room


Hosted by the Cal Career Center and Centers for Educational Equity and Excellence (CE3), the 2nd annual First-Generation Career Conference will bring together students and industry professionals to discuss topics around career development and issues facing first-generation students. This is a great way for first generation students to discuss shared experiences, learn more about career development (on topics such as leadership, search strategies, interviewing, networking, and more) and connect with professionals across many industries.

We will kick off the conference with a dynamic keynote speech by Thuy Thi Nguyen J.D., President of Foothill College, followed by concurrent workshops, refreshments and a networking session with professionals.  

For more info and to RSVP, please go to the Handshake event page.

SkyDeck Open House

If you're interested in entrepreneurship, SkyDeck is hosting its Spring 2018 Open House on February 22nd from 4-6pm. Come meet the Berkeley entrepreneurship community, get to know the SkyDeck internal team, and learn how you can become the school's next moonshot! Program introductions begin at 4:30pm. Refreshments will be provided.


RSVP link: http://bit.ly/2ExB8fs

Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU)

Motivated and talented students are invited to apply for paid summer research internships to gain hands-on research experience in stimulating the spread of malware on smartphones, implementing cryptographic algorithms and authentication schemes for smartphones, studying topology control of wireless networks, geolocating smartphones, detecting physical attack on a network of smartphones, and developing privacy-protected medical sensing methods using smartphones. Since the selection process is very competitive, students are advised to obtain letters of recommendation from their professors early on.


Where: NSF REU Site at NYIT New York Manhattan Campus


When: May 30 - August 3, 2018


Application Deadline: February 28, 2018


What: Paid Summer Research Experience ($5,000 stipend for the summer,

plus housing and travel expenses covered)


Requirements:

  • US Citizens or Permanent Residents

  • Rising junior or senior majoring in a STEM field with an interest in cybersecurity are strongly encouraged to apply, though freshmen may also be considered

  • GPA of 3.2 or above


Project Lead: Dr. Ziqian (Cecilia) Dong (Ziqian.Dong@nyit.edu)
